reasoning:

I have 3 Spades and 3 Diamonds. To make a flush, I need 5 cards of the same suit.

- Diamonds: 6 remaining in deck
- Hearts: 18 remaining in deck

I should try to get 2 more Spades or 2 more Diamonds. Spades seems better since there are more in the deck.

The base flush at Level 5 gives 95 chips and 12 mult, plus Crafty Joker adds 80 chips and Droll Joker adds 10 mult when I hit the flush, with 8 Ball contributing another 50 chips.

Working through the math: a 5-card flush would yield around 342 total chips multiplied by 37x for roughly 12,654 pointsâ€”far below my goal. I'm clearly misunderstanding something about how the scoring compounds or how the jokers interact with the hand value.

The foil edition bonus on 8 Ball triggers when the joker activates, adding chips directly to that joker's contribution. Since independent jokers process sequentially from left to right, the timing of when each joker activates affects the final calculation. Blue Joker's value also fluctuates based on how many cards remain in the deck, so when I scored 20,406 earlier, it was likely worth considerably more than it is now.

My best move is to discard the non-Spade cards and draw replacements, hoping to assemble a stronger Spade-heavy hand.
